H0.text: Deciduous trees are the type of tree dominant in temperate forests.

H1.text: Vines are the type of tree that is dominant in temperate forests.

H2.text: Fungus is the type of tree that is dominant in temperate forests.

H3.text: Shrubs are the type of tree that is dominant in temperate forests.

A4.text: In the Northern Hemisphere, characteristic dominant broadleaf trees in this biome include oaks (Quercus spp.), beeches (Fagus spp.), and spruces (Picea spp.), maples (Acer spp.), or birches (Betula spp.).

A5.text: In some areas of this biome, the conifers may be a more important canopy species than the broadleaf species.

A6.text: Deciduous forests are composed mainly of broadleaf trees, such as maple and oak, that shed all their leaves during one season.
